taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs sympatrically with Acantopsis.  Found in medium to large-sized rivers (Ref. 12975).  Feeds on the bottom on insects and algae (Ref. 12975).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2013. Acanthopsoides gracilis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: The species is recorded from the middle and upper Chao Phraya (Thailand) and the lower Mekong (including the Tonle Sap and tributaries in Cambodia; Kottelat 1985). Kang (2009) reports the species from the Upper Mekong in Yunnan, China, an extension of the species' distribution that requires confirmation.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Chao Phraya (Thailand) and Mekong basins.  Also recorded from Kapuas River of Western Borneo, Indonesia (Ref. 2091).

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2013. Acanthopsoides gracilis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
Allen, D.

Reviewer/s
Kottelat, M., Vidthayanon, C. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species has a wide distribution in the Chao Phraya and Lower Mekong basins. Although information is required on threats, it is considered Least Concern at present.
